result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob M. Knab was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jacob M. Knab is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jacob M. Knab was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jacob M. Knab

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: defendant called and will be stopping in on Friday to pay
will be in tomorrow to make payment for Jan.
from defendant - will be in on 11/6/15 with $50 payment

2:55 p.m. Attorney Mary Margaret Hogan in court.  Steven Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State moves to amend Count 1 to ordinance possession of THC - Count 2 dimiss - Granted.  Hogan enters no contest plea.  Court finds guilty - imposes $263.50 fine.  Review hearing scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

02:59 pm - Defendant Jacob M. Knab in court with attorney Mary Margaret Hogan.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

04:05 pm - Defendant Jacob M. Knab in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court questions defendant as to obtaining counsel.  Defendant states has not contacted PD office - just didn't get to it.  Defendant is unsure as to how to proceed.  Court will adjourn one more time.  Bail continued.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 6, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

01:43 pm - Defendant Jacob M. Knab in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court quashes warrant - not yet issued.  Defendant failed to appear on 6/1/15.  Defendant states missed appearance because thought the appearance date was June 3rd - lost the citation - also had work on the 1st.    In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD,  Michlig statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 29, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jacob M. Knab not in court.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
No appearance - misdemeanor citation filed- Court authorizes warrant -
